intro: Orthosiphon adornatus var. angolensis, commonly known as African rooster's comb, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowering spikes produce clusters of tiny, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in traditional medicine for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
